docs.text: Vultr Docs This repository hosts code samples and support files for Vultr Docs . If you would like to write articles for Vultr Docs, please review these resources: The Request for Article (RFA) list Vultr Docs Program Guidelines Vultr Docs Style Guide
docs.title: About Vultr Docs

docs.text: Request for Article (RFA) List If you are looking for topic inspiration, Vultr has many writing opportunities available! Please see our Request for Article list below. If you are new to Vultr Docs, we suggest working on articles that need updates before choosing a new topic. See the Submission Process section to learn how to get started. Article Requests ID Title RFA Type Tags Notes 649337625 How install and use a GUI on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS New Desktop Guides, Ubuntu 647085292 How to Deploy a MERN Application on Ubuntu New Ubuntu 643432812 Redirect WordPress IP to domain name New WordPress, Nginx 648909225 How to Install and Configure Concourse CI on CentOS 7 Update CentOS 643423386 How to Install OpenMeetings on Ubuntu 20.04 Update Ubuntu An author is in progress. 646022891 How to Install RabbitMQ on CentOS 7 Update CentOS 644027681 How to use Certbot on yum-based LEMP Update CentOS, Security 643416786 Install PostgreSQL On CentOS 7 Update PostgreSQL, CentOS 644036625 Setup 7 Days to Die Server on Ubuntu 14 Update Game Servers, Ubuntu 650267373 Use an SSH Key with Non-root Users Update System Admin Submission Process If you plan to write one of the articles below, please: Review our program guidelines and the style guide . Join the Vultr Trusted Author program . Request the article assignment using this form . Include Request for Article and the ID number in the Request topic. Include your name and email address so we may contact you. Include any information that may help us select the best candidate for the assignment. We will contact you with more information about the article specifics and our internal notes. When your article is ready for review please upload it to the Vultr Docs team . Please include Request for Article and the ID number in the Additional Information field. FAQ Can I start writing right now? You might want to learn more about the specific request before getting started. Unfortunately, we don't have room on this page to list every details. Please request the article using the steps above before starting. Can I request multiple articles? We make one assignment per author at a time. Publication and Payment Responding to an open RFA, or accepting an RFA assignment does not create an obligation by Vultr to publish your article. You may be asked to make changes or corrections, or the team may decline to publish your article without a detailed explanation. Payment is determined according to Vultr’s payment guidelines and article quality .
docs.title: Request for Article

docs.text: If you plan to write one of the articles below, please: Review our program guidelines and the style guide . Join the Vultr Trusted Author program . Request the article assignment using this form . Include Request for Article and the ID number in the Request topic. Include your name and email address so we may contact you. Include any information that may help us select the best candidate for the assignment. We will contact you with more information about the article specifics and our internal notes. When your article is ready for review please upload it to the Vultr Docs team . Please include Request for Article and the ID number in the Additional Information field.
docs.title: Submission Process

docs.text: You might want to learn more about the specific request before getting started. Unfortunately, we don't have room on this page to list every details. Please request the article using the steps above before starting.

docs.text: Responding to an open RFA, or accepting an RFA assignment does not create an obligation by Vultr to publish your article. You may be asked to make changes or corrections, or the team may decline to publish your article without a detailed explanation. Payment is determined according to Vultr’s payment guidelines and article quality .
